subject: Cybersecurity
title: Titan Rain: China's Cyber Espionage Campaign
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Titan Rain: China's Cyber Espionage Campaign.

hook.text: Between 2003 and 2005, hackers systematically raided U.S. defense contractors and military networks.

buildup.text: Titan Rain targeted Lockheed Martin, Sandia National Labs, and NASA, stealing massive amounts of sensitive data.

discovery.text: Analyst Shawn Carpenter traced the attacks to servers in Guangdong, China â€” and was fired for investigating.

twist.text: Carpenter was fired for 'unauthorized investigation,' then sued and won. The whistleblower became the story.

climax.text: Titan Rain revealed that cyber espionage was an ongoing, industrial-scale operation by nation-states.

punchline.text: He found the hackers and got fired for it.

quiz.question: What happened to analyst Shawn Carpenter after tracing Titan Rain?
options: He was fired for unauthorized investigation
He was recruited by the NSA
